description: From Middle French impur, from Latin impÅ«rus.

adjectives.description: impure (comparative more impure, superlative most impure)

examples: The impure gemstone was not good enough to be made into a necklace, so it was thrown out.

entries.meaning: Unhallowed; defiled by something unholy, either physically by an objectionable substance, or morally by guilt or sin
Unchaste; obscene (not according to or not abiding by some system of sexual morality)
examples: He was thinking impure thoughts involving a girl from school.

verbs.description: impure (third-person singular simple present impures, present participle impuring, simple past and past participle impured)
